internet.description: Used to inform the client device whether internet access is available

access_network_type.description: The access network type present in beacon and probe response frames

hessid.description: Homogeneous ESS identifier (optional). This shall be identifical to one of the BSSIDs in the homogeneous ESS

roaming_consortium.description: 3 or 5 octets hexstring. Only first three entries are available through Beacon and Probe Response frames

network_auth_type.description: Indicates what type of network authentication is used in the network

enum-pretty.3: Single NATed private IPv4 address available
enum-pretty.4: Double NATed private IPv4 address available
enum-pretty.5: Port-restricted IPv4 address and single NATed IPv4 address available
enum-pretty.6: Port-restricted IPv4 address and double NATed IPv4 address available
enum-pretty.7: Availability of the address type is not known

ipaddr_type_availability.description: Provides information about the IP address version and type and that would be available to a mobile device after it authenticates to the network

domain_name.description: The Domain Name ANQP-element provides a list of one or more domain names of the entity operating the hotspot network

venue_group.description: Describes the venue in which the hotspot is located

venue_type.description: Describes the venue in which the hotspot is located

osu_ssid.description: Informs client device about the SSID used for OSU connections

osu_friendly_name_lang.description: Two or three character language code (ISO-639)

hs20_wan_status.description: Provides information about the WAN link that connects the hotspot to the internet

country_code.description: Two or three character language code (ISO-639)

url.description: Venue URL to provide additional information corresponding to Venue Name information (URL should contain protocol)

mobile_network_code.description: Mobile network code (2 or 3 decimal digits)

hostname.description: The NAI Realm provides a list of NAI realms corresponding to the Home SPs that can authenticate a client device

auth_num.description: Identifies the EAP method supported by that NAI realm for authentication.

name.description: Provides the friendly name of the Hotspot Operator

country_code.description: Two or three character language code (ISO-639)
